User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the CanvasMind application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

microphonePermission.description: The user's stored preference for microphone access.

CanvasBoard.title: CanvasBoard
CanvasBoard.description: Represents a canvas board where users create and organize content.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CanvasBoard entity.

name.description: The name of the canvas board.

description.description: A description of the canvas board.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the canvas board was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the canvas board was last updated.

lastView.description: Stores the last known camera/viewport state for this board.

CanvasElement.title: CanvasElement
CanvasElement.description: Represents an element on the canvas, such as a notepad, sticky note, image, or text.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CanvasElement entity.

type.description: The type of canvas element (e.g., notepad, sticky note, image, text, todolist).

x.description: The x-coordinate of the element on the canvas.

y.description: The y-coordinate of the element on the canvas.

zIndex.description: The z-index of the element (stacking order).

content.description: The content of the canvas element (e.g., text, image URL, notepad data).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the canvas element was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the canvas element was last updated.

params.name: userId

definition.description: A subcollection under each canvas board containing all the visual elements (notes, images, etc.) for that board.

params.name: userId
params.description: The UID of the user who owns the parent board.

params.name: canvasBoardId
params.description: The ID of the canvas board this element belongs to.

params.name: canvasElementId
params.description: The unique identifier for the canvas element.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support CanvasMind's core features - Visual Canvas, Note Organization with AI Assistance, Real-time Collaboration, Multimedia Integration, Database and Authentication, and Voice Dictation - while adhering to the core design principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), QAPs (Rules are not Filters), and Invariants.

**Authorization Independence:** Authorization is enforced using path-based ownership for user-specific data. CanvasBoards and CanvasElements are stored as subcollections of users, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules and enabling atomic operations.

**Clarity of Intent:** The structure explicitly defines ownership and relationships, making authorization intent clear. User-owned data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, and nested data follows a hierarchical structure.

**DBAC (Database-Based Access Control):** Roles and permissions are managed solely based on the `request.auth.uid` and path-based ownership, avoiding the use of custom claims.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The segregation of user data into separate collections enables secure `list` operations. Users can only list CanvasBoards and CanvasElements that belong to them.

**Invariants:** The structure supports the integrity of ownership through path-based ownership. Timestamps can be enforced using security rules.

**Justification:**

*   `/users/{userId}`: This collection stores user profiles. Security rules will ensure that only the authenticated user can read/write their profile data.
*   `/users/{userId}/canvasBoards/{canvasBoardId}`: This subcollection stores canvas boards owned by a specific user. The `userId` parameter establishes ownership. Each document contains the properties associated to the boards.
*   `/users/{userId}/canvasBoards/{canvasBoardId}/canvasElements/{canvasElementId}`: This subcollection stores canvas elements associated with a specific canvas board. The `canvasBoardId` and `userId` parameters establishes ownership. Each document contains the properties associated to the elements.
